{
  "article_text": [
    "the simulations reported here use the standard wilson action , which reproduces the continuum action up to corrections of order @xmath15 . for the generation of the gauge configurations we used the chroma library  @xcite and a combined monte carlo sweep of seven over - relaxation updates with four heat bath updates .",
    "the gauge configurations generated by importance sampling were rotated to the landau gauge by maximising the function @xmath16 = \\frac{1}{v n_d n_c } \\sum_{x , \\mu }  \\mbox{re tr } \\left [  g(x ) \\ , u_\\mu ( x ) \\",
    ", g^\\dagger ( x + a \\hat{e}_\\mu ) \\right ] \\ , \\ ] ] over each gauge orbit associated to the link @xmath17 , where @xmath18 is the number of the lattice points , @xmath19 is the number of space - time dimensions , @xmath20 is the number of colours and @xmath21 is the unit vector along the lattice direction @xmath22 .",
    "the gauge fixing , i.e. the maximisation of @xmath23 $ ] , was performed with the fourier accelerated steepest descent method described in  @xcite , which was implemented using chroma and pfft  @xcite libraries .",
    "the quality of the gauge fixing was monitored with @xmath24\\ ] ] where @xmath25   \\ , \\ ] ] the lattice version of the landau gauge fixing condition @xmath26 . for each gauge configuration , the gauge fixing was stopped when @xmath27 .    for the computation of the complete green s functions we take the definitions as those in  @xcite .",
    "the gluon field is given by @xmath28}{6 i g_0 } + \\mathcal{o}(a^2 ) \\ , \\end{gathered}\\ ] ] which reads in momentum space as @xmath29 where @xmath30 and @xmath31 is the number of lattice points in direction @xmath22 .",
    "the results reported are given in terms of the tree level improved momentum @xmath32 furthermore , to minimise lattice artefacts associated to the break of the rotational symmetry , for momenta above 1 gev we only report the data surviving to the momentum cuts as defined in  @xcite .",
    "for the evaluation of the statistical errors , the results reported here rely on the bootstrap method using a confidence level of 67.5% .",
    "our goal is to describe the three gluon vertex which requires the computation of the complete green function ( [ eq : npointgreen ] ) for two and three external legs . on the lattice ,",
    "the two point function is given by @xmath33 where , in the landau gauge , the gluon propagator reads @xmath34 and the orthogonal projector is given by @xmath35    the three point complete green s function has a similar definition @xmath36 and it can be written in terms of the gluon propagator and of the 1pi vertex as @xmath37 where there is an implicit sum over the @xmath38 and @xmath39 indices .",
    "the color structure of the three gluon vertex allows one to write the 1pi as @xmath40 where @xmath41 stands for the su(3 ) group structure constants .",
    "bose symmetry requires the vertex to be symmetric under the interchange of any pair @xmath42 and it follows that @xmath43 must be antisymmetric under interchange of any pair of @xmath44 .    in order to describe the @xmath43 one has to define a given lorentz tensor basis of operators .",
    "its general form in the continuum has been investigated in  @xcite and decomposes the 1pi function in terms of transverse @xmath45 and longitudinal @xmath46 components .",
    "the function @xmath43 can be written in terms of six lorentz invariant form factors with two form factors associated to @xmath45 and the remaining associated to @xmath46 .",
    "the details of the decomposition in terms of the form factors can be found in appendix  [ sec : gammaballchiu ] .    our starting point to access the 1pi three gluon vertex is the following color trace    @xmath47    where , to simplify the above expression",
    ", we have omitted the factor @xmath48 and where @xmath49 means average over gauge configurations .",
    "we call the reader s attention , that in previous lattice calculations of the three gluon 1pi for the gauge groups su(2 ) and su(3 ) the authors considered a different function , named generically @xmath50 , which is given by a ratio of two and three point correlation functions ; see  @xcite for details .",
    "lattice.,width=316 ]    the lattice simulations can only measure the green s functions on a limited set of kinematical configurations .",
    "herein , we report the results of the simulations performed using @xmath51 and @xmath52 lattices and for @xmath53 . for the conversion into physical units",
    "we take the lattice spacing as measured from the string tension  @xcite and , therefore , @xmath54 gev or @xmath55 fm .",
    "the smaller lattice has a physical volume of @xmath56 @xmath57 . for the smallest lattice ,",
    "the smallest momentum is @xmath58 mev and we generated 2000 gauge configurations .",
    "the largest lattice has a physical volume of @xmath59 @xmath57 , the smallest momentum being @xmath60 mev and we use 279 gauge configurations in the computation of all correlation functions .    in fig .",
    "[ fig : prop ] the bare landau gauge gluon propagator and dressing function @xmath61 are reported as a function of momenta . for @xmath62 above 1 gev",
    "the data plotted includes only those momenta which satisfy the cuts as defined in  @xcite .",
    "for momenta below 1 gev we have included all lattice data points .",
    "no clear finite size and volume effects are seen in the gluon propagator data . indeed , for the smaller momenta",
    ", if we plotted @xmath63 separating the different types of momenta , i.e. the @xmath64 momenta from @xmath65 and from @xmath66 , the bare lattice data seems to define a unique curve .",
    "the propagator for the different types of momenta can be seen in fig .",
    "[ fig : propxxx ] for the @xmath51 lattice .",
    "although , at the level of the gluon propagator there seems to be no finite size effects , the same does not apply to the computation of the three point function , as seen below .",
    "let us consider the case where one of the gluon momenta vanishes , i.e. @xmath67 .",
    "this particular kinematical configuration was investigated in the first lattice study of the three gluon vertex  @xcite and was used to compute the strong coupling constant . for a gluon with @xmath68 , the momentum projector operator simplifies and is given by @xmath69 .",
    "a straightforward calculation shows that the continuum complete three point green function requires only the knowledge of two longitudinal form factors and @xmath70 ^ 2 \\ , d(0 ) \\\\",
    "\\frac{\\gamma ( p^2)}{3 } ~ ~ p_{\\mu_2 } ~t_{\\mu_1\\mu_3 } ( p )      \\label{eq : g3basico}\\end{gathered}\\ ] ] where @xmath71 is given in terms of the invariant form factors introduced in  @xcite as @xmath72 \\ ; \\ ] ] see also appendix  [ sec : gammaballchiu ] . note that there is an overall minus sign relative to the expressions reported in appendix  [ sec : gammaballchiu ] which is due to the rotation to the euclidean space . in the following",
    ", we will report the form factor @xmath71 as measured from the combination @xmath73 ^ 2 \\ , d(0 ) ~~\\gamma ( p^2 ) ~~ p^2 \\ ,     \\label{eq : ffactorp0p }   \\end{gathered}\\ ] ] where we use the momentum definition as given in eq , ( [ eq : defmom ] ) .",
    "we recall the reader that the color factor @xmath74 appearing in ( [ eq : tracecompleto ] ) was omitted in the above expression .    for the gauge group su(2 ) ,",
    "the authors  @xcite considered instead of @xmath71 , the contraction of the complete green function with the lattice tree level tensor structure @xmath75 , i.e. the function    @xmath76    the lattice tree level @xmath75 can be found in e.g.  @xcite .",
    "a straightforward calculation using the decomposition reported in app .  [ sec : gammaballchiu ] , and assuming the continuum expressions for the various quantities , shows that @xmath77 .",
    "the measurement of the form factor @xmath71 requires the computation of the ratio @xmath78 ^ 2 \\ , d(0)$ ] .",
    "the evaluation of this ratio introduces large statistical fluctuations which severely limit the estimation of @xmath71 at high momenta . indeed , assuming gaussian error propagation for the estimation of the statistical error on @xmath71",
    ", it follows that @xmath79 ^ 2 = \\frac{1}{\\left[d(p^2)\\right]^4 } \\bigg\\ {      \\left [ \\frac { \\delta g_{\\mu \\alpha \\mu }   p_\\alpha } { d(0)}\\right]^2 \\\\ +      \\left [ 2 ~ \\delta d(p^2 ) ~   \\ ,   \\frac {   g_{\\mu \\alpha \\mu }   p_\\alpha } { d(p^2 ) \\ , d(0)}\\right]^2   \\\\ +      \\left [ 2 ~ \\delta d(0 ) ~   \\ ,   \\frac {   g_{\\mu \\alpha \\mu }   p_\\alpha } { \\left[d(0)\\right]^2}\\right]^2 \\bigg\\ } \\ , \\end{gathered}\\ ] ] where @xmath80 stands for the statistical error on the quantity @xmath81 . for large momentum @xmath82 , therefore , and @xmath83 and it follows that the statistical error on @xmath71 become quite large at higher momentum .",
    "a direct measurement of @xmath71 with controllable statistical errors is possible only at relatively small momentum .",
    "_ a priori _ , if the statistical errors on the various quantities are small enough or close to zero , then one can hope to measure the form factor with a relatively good statistical precision .",
    "however , even in the case of a very large number of gauge configurations , which produces a gluon propagator with tiny statistical errors , the statistical errors on the three point correlation function dominate and again @xmath84 .",
    "so , the only function that the lattice can provide for large momentum with controllable statistical errors is the combination @xmath85 ^ 2 \\ , d(0 ) \\",
    ", \\gamma ( p^2)$ ] .",
    "certainly , an improvement on the quality of data for ultraviolet region has to go beyond the increase on the number of configurations .",
    "this is a severe limitation of the lattice approach to the evaluation of the three gluon 1pi and it also applies to the computation of other 1pi with larger number of external legs .",
    "for the infrared region , the situation is not so dramatic as @xmath63 is essentially constant and the signal to noise ratio can be improved by considering larger ensembles of gauge configurations .    in order to evaluate possible finite size effects on the lattice computation of @xmath71 , in fig .",
    "[ fig:1pixxx ] we plot the form factor as a function of the different type of momenta for the two lattices considered here .",
    "for the smaller lattice , which uses an ensemble with 2000 gauge configurations , the data for the smallest momenta of type @xmath86 are above the remaining sets of momenta . for the larger lattice , which uses and ensemble of 279 gauge configurations , the estimation of @xmath71 for momenta of type @xmath86 provides no valuable information on the form factors .",
    "the @xmath87 data for the simulation using the @xmath52 lattice have large statistical errors and its compatible with a constant value and the comparison between the two simulations for this type of momenta does not help in the understanding of the quality of the data . on the other hand , with the exception of the momenta of type @xmath86 , the results coming from the two lattices volumes for @xmath87 are basically the same for the different types of momenta .",
    "the difference in the statistical errors associated with the two simulations using the @xmath52 and @xmath51 lattices are due to the difference in the number of configurations in each ensemble .",
    "further , given that one expects larger finite size effects for momenta of type @xmath86 , we will ignore the outcome of the simulations associated with this type momenta from now on .     from the @xmath51 and @xmath52 simulations.,width=316 ]",
    "the form factors @xmath71 for both data sets and for momenta up to 2 gev can be seen in fig .",
    "[ fig:1pigoodall1 ] .",
    "as expected , the data for the larger lattice is much noisier than the data for the smaller lattice and this just translates the difference in the size of the ensembles used in the calculation . despite the larger statistical errors associated to the @xmath52 results , the figures of the two data sets are essentially compatible within one standard deviation .",
    "as expected and discussed above the statistical errors increase substantially as one approaches the uv region and , therefore , we have chosen to exclude the `` high '' momenta in the comparison . the striking point being that for the lowest available momenta @xmath88 mev the form factor describing the three gluon vertex becomes negative @xmath71 = -0.80(37 ) and is compatible with zero only within to 2.2 standard deviations",
    "further , if one takes into account the two data points of fig .",
    "[ fig:1pigoodall1 ] which correspond to @xmath89 and @xmath90 from the simulation with the @xmath51 lattice and @xmath91 from the simulation with the @xmath52 lattice , the data suggests that the zero crossing for @xmath92 should occur for momenta below @xmath93 mev .",
    "the simulations performed for the gauge group su(2 )  @xcite also suggest that the form factor becomes negative at around the same momentum scale .",
    "the change of sign seen in the recent lattice simulation for su(3 )  @xcite also occurs for momenta within the same range as observed here .     from the @xmath51 simulation.,width=316",
    "]    the computation using the smaller physical volume has small statistical errors , although the zero crossing is not observed . in fig .",
    "[ fig:1pigoodall2 ] and for completeness we report only the data from the simulation using the @xmath51 data but for an enlarged momentum range .",
    "the study of the ultraviolet behaviour can be performed if one looks to the combination @xmath94 ^ 2 \\ , d(0 ) ~ \\gamma ( p^2 ) ~ p^2 \\ .\\ ] ] the one - loop renormalization group improved result for the gluon propagator at high momentum reads @xmath95^{-\\gamma}}{p^2 } \\ , \\ ] ] where @xmath96 is a constant , @xmath22 is a renormalization scale and @xmath97 is the gluon anomalous dimension .",
    "the equivalent result for the three gluon 1pi is given by @xmath98^{\\gamma_{3g}}\\ ] ] where the anomalous dimension reads @xmath99 .",
    "it follows that for sufficiently high momentum @xmath100^ { \\gamma_{3 g } - 2 \\gamma }      \\label{eq : pert3glue}\\ ] ] and @xmath101 .",
    "the results for @xmath102 measured from the simulation using the @xmath51 lattice and for the full range of momenta can be seen in fig .",
    "[ fig:1piuv ] .",
    "it includes also the tree level estimation of @xmath103 and the prediction of eq .",
    "( [ eq : pert3glue ] ) .",
    "the normalization constants were set to reproduce the lattice result for momenta @xmath104 gev and we used for @xmath105 gev to generate the renormalisation improved results . despite the large statistical errors , the data follows the predictions of perturbation theory for @xmath62 above @xmath106 gev .",
    "this result can be seen as a validation of the perturbative approach to qcd for sufficiently high momenta .     from the @xmath51 simulation .",
    "the curves are the predictions from perturbation theory .",
    "the data points show are those which survive the momentum cuts introduced in  @xcite .",
    "see text for further details.,width=316 ]",
    "in the current work we have computed the three gluon complete green s function on the lattice for a particular kinematical configuration and for two different lattices with volume of @xmath56 @xmath57 and @xmath59 @xmath57 .",
    "we considered a single value for the lattice spacing @xmath55 fm and , therefore , one can not estimate possible effects due to the use of a finite @xmath107 .    for the gluon propagator ,",
    "the results of the two simulations are compatible within one standard deviation and no finite volume effects are observed .",
    "this result is in good agreement with our recent studies for the gluon propagator  @xcite . on the other hand ,",
    "the computation of the 1pi three gluon vertex shows that , in the infrared region , the estimation of @xmath71 depends on the type of momenta considered .",
    "this is a clear sign of rotational symmetry breaking effects .",
    "the data also suggests that , in the infrared region , momenta of type @xmath108 over - estimates the 1pi in comparison with the other types of momenta .",
    "the simulations produce a form factor @xmath71 , see figs .",
    "[ fig:1pigoodall1 ] ,  [ fig:1pigoodall2 ] and  [ fig:1piuv ] , that is essentially a constant function at high momenta . for momenta below @xmath109 gev , is a decreasing function of @xmath110 which vanish at @xmath111 mev and becomes negative for smaller momenta .",
    "the change of sign associated to the three gluon vertex has also been reported recently in lattice simulations of four dimensional pure yang - mills for the gauge group su(3 )  @xcite and has been reported for three dimensional pure yang - mills for the gauge group su(2 ) in  @xcite .",
    "all the lattice simulations point towards the same momentum scale for the zero crossing of the three gluon vertex .",
    "as discussed in  @xcite the observed change of sign in the three gluon vertex seems to be a requirement to have a properly defined dyson - schwinger equation for the gluon propagator .    in what concerns the high momentum region ,",
    "the lattice data is compatible with the prediction of the renormalisation group improved perturbation theory . in this sense",
    ", our data validates the perturbative approach to qcd for the uv region .    in the current work",
    ", we also discussed the limitation of the lattice approach to the evaluation of 1pi for the case of multiple gluon legs .",
    "our conclusion being that , within the approach considered here , the uv region will be always plagued with large statistical errors and , therefore , the method is not able to access the high momentum region in a way to extract reliable information . instead , for higher momenta one can consider combinations of the 1pi and correlation functions with smaller number of external legs .",
    "combined with a very accurate estimation of these later functions one can , in principle , still get some usual information about the uv behaviour of the 1pi .",
    "an accurate estimation of the 1pi in the uv region clearly requires going beyond the increase of the size of configuration ensembles .",
    "for completeness , here we describe the tensor basis introduced in  @xcite to describe the @xmath43 function of the 1pi three gluon vertex defined in eq .",
    "( [ eq : gammalorentz ] ) . in minkowsky space ,",
    "the transverse component of the vertex parts reads    @xmath113 \\ , b^3_{\\mu_3 } \\\\",
    "+ h(p^2_1 , p^2_2 , p^2_3 ) \\left [ -g_{\\mu_1\\mu_2}\\ , b^3_{\\mu_3 } + \\frac{1}{3 } \\big ( { p_1}_{\\mu_3 } ~ { p_2}_{\\mu_1 } ~ { p_3}_{\\mu_2 }                                                                                              - { p_1}_{\\mu_2 } ~ { p_2}_{\\mu_3 } ~ { p_3}_{\\mu_1 }   \\big ) \\right ] \\\\                                                                                              + ~\\mbox {  cyclic permutations }   \\label{3g_trans}\\end{gathered}\\ ] ]    where @xmath114 @xmath115 is a scalar function symmetric under interchange of the first two arguments and @xmath116 is totally symmetric under interchange of its arguments .",
    "it follows from the definition that @xmath117 and bose symmetry of the vertex ensures that the contractions with @xmath118 and @xmath119 also vanishes . on the other hand ,",
    "the longitudinal part of the vertex is given by      where the scalar functions @xmath121 and @xmath122 are symmetric in their first two arguments , @xmath123 is antisymmetric and @xmath124 is antisymmetric under exchange of any pair of arguments .",
    "the full 1pi reads @xmath125    on the lattice one computes the green function ( [ eq : glat ] ) on a reduced set of momentum configurations and from lattice simulations can only access combinations of the form factors @xmath126 , @xmath127 , @xmath3 , @xmath128 , @xmath129 , @xmath130 on a finite set of momentum configurations .",
    "the authors acknowledge the laboratory for advanced computing at university of coimbra for providing hpc computing resources navigator that have contributed to the research results reported within this paper ( url http://www.lca.uc.pt ) .",
    "this work was granted access to the hpc resources of the pdc center for high performance computing at the kth royal institute of technology , sweden , made available within the distributed european computing initiative by the prace-2ip , receiving funding from the european community s seventh framework programme ( fp7/2007 - 2013 ) under grand agreement no .",
    "the use of lindgren has been provided under deci-9 project coimbralatt .",
    "we acknowledge that the results of this research have been achieved using the prace-3ip project ( fp7 ri-312763 ) resource sisu based in finland at csc .",
    "the use of sisu has been provided under deci-12 project coimbralatt2 .",
    "p. j. silva acknowledges partial support by fct under contract no .",
    "sfrh / bpd/40998/2007 ."

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> the three gluon one particle irreducible function is investigated using lattice qcd simulations over a large region of momentum in the landau gauge for four dimensional pure yang - mills equations and the su(3 ) gauge group . </S>",
    "<S> the results favor a zero crossing of the gluon form factor for momenta in the range @xmath0 mev . </S>",
    "<S> this zero crossing is required to happen in order to have a properly defined set of dyson - schwinger equations . </S>",
    "<S> it is also shown that in the high momentum region the lattice results are compatible with the predictions of renormalisation group improved perturbation theory .    </S>",
    "<S> the non - perturbative computation of the qcd green s functions is an important step towards the understanding of the dynamics of strong interactions . </S>",
    "<S> the calculation of the green s functions over the full momentum range is a non - trivial task , independently of taking into account or not the contribution of quarks . </S>",
    "<S> the lattice approach to qcd allows for first principles determination of the @xmath1-point complete green functions as for example @xmath2 where @xmath3 stands for the gluon field and where we have omitted the color and lorentz indices . in momentum space the green s functions reads @xmath4 the complete green s functions @xmath5 can be decomposed in terms of one particle irreducible ( 1pi ) functions @xmath6 and , therefore , from @xmath5 one can have access to the various form factors or combination of form factors that define @xmath6 .    for a quantum field theory </S>",
    "<S> the knowledge of the 1pi enables the computation of any green s function , of the matrix s and the determination of the cross sections predicted by the theory . </S>",
    "<S> furthermore , the 1pi functions summarise , like the green s functions , the dynamics of the theory and for qcd they encode information on quark and gluon confinement . for gauge theories the green s functions and the 1pi are gauge dependent objects and , therefore </S>",
    "<S> , one has to choose _ a priori _ a given gauge .    in this paper </S>",
    "<S> , we will report on lattice qcd results for the su(3 ) pure yang - mills theory in the minimal landau gauge </S>",
    "<S> . the focus will be on the momentum space three point green s function @xmath7 and the corresponding 1pi function @xmath8 .    </S>",
    "<S> the computation of the three point green s function is connected with multiple properties of the strong interactions . </S>",
    "<S> for example , from @xmath9 one can define a static potential between color charges or measure the strong coupling constant  @xcite , an important phenomenological input for studying strong interaction physics .    </S>",
    "<S> the three point function is also a crucial ingredient in the continuum approach to strong interactions . </S>",
    "<S> indeed , the reproduction of the lattice results for the gluon and ghost propagators using the dyson - schwinger equations requires a proper description of this correlation function  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> furthermore , in the continuum approach to non - perturbative qcd , the three gluon vertex plays a fundamental role in the structure of the dyson - schwinger equations ( dse ) . </S>",
    "<S> indeed , given that the ghost propagator is described by an essentially massless particle type of propagator , the ghost loops in the dse give rise to a new type of divergences which , to be removed and to define a finite set of equations , introduce non - trivial constraints into the structure of the green s functions with a higher number of external legs .    </S>",
    "<S> for the particular case of the pure yang - mills theory and for the gluon dyson - schwinger equation , assuming an essentially tree level like ghost propagator , and assuming that the four - gluon vertex is subleading in the infrared region , the requirement of a finite dse for the gluon requires that certain form factors associated with the three gluon 1pi change sign for momentum in the ir region  @xcite and , therefore , they become zero at certain kinematical points . similar requirements on @xmath6 for @xmath10 also appear when one considers the dse associated to the green functions with a larger number of external legs  @xcite . in this sense </S>",
    "<S> , the cancelation of the divergences associated to the ghost loop in the dse provides a highly non - trivial constrain on 1pi at sufficiently small momenta .    in what concerns the three gluon vertex in pure yang - mills theory , </S>",
    "<S> the zero crossing of the form factors describing the 1pi has been observed in lattice simulations in three space - time dimensions but not in four dimensional simulations for the gauge group su(2 )  @xcite . for su(3 ) pure yang - mills in four dimensions , the change of sign was reported very recently in  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> furthermore , the change of sign was also seen in the solutions of the dyson - schwinger equations for the three gluon vertex  @xcite , on the variational solution of qcd in the coulomb gauge  @xcite and on the description of the yang - mills theory via the curci - ferrari model  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> although the momentum scale where the zero crossing in the three gluon vertex sets in is not exactly the same in all the works just mentioned , it seems to be a common feature of the modern description of the three gluon vertex . in three dimensional su(2 ) </S>",
    "<S> lattice simulations  @xcite the momentum scale where the form factors become negative was estimated as a value in the range @xmath11  @xmath12 mev . </S>",
    "<S> the study of the gluon dse  @xcite reports a momentum scale of @xmath13  </S>",
    "<S> @xmath14 mev where the change of sign for the three gluon vertex occurs . the lattice simulation for su(3 ) </S>",
    "<S> points towards a momentum scale that is clearly above 100 mev  @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> as investigated in  @xcite , the inclusion of the dynamical effects in the three gluon vertex confirms the pattern described above with the zero crossing happening within the same scales of momentum as in the quenched theory .    in the current paper we report on su(3 ) lattice estimations of the three gluon vertex for pure yang - mills theory in the minimal landau gauge . </S>",
    "<S> our aim is to provide further evidence that the form factors associated to this 1pi function vanish for certain kinematical configurations and deliver information which can help to parametrise the three gluon 1pi in the continuum approach to qcd .    </S>",
    "<S> this work is organised as follows . in sec . </S>",
    "<S> [ sec : def ] we resume the lattice setup and the definitions used throughout the paper . in sec . </S>",
    "<S> [ sec : green ] we describe the various type of green functions considered here and , in particular , the one particle irreducible function associated to the three gluon vertex . in sec . </S>",
    "<S> [ sec : resultados ] the lattice simulation results are reported for two different lattices . finally , in sec . </S>",
    "<S> [ sec : final ] we summarize and conclude . in app . </S>",
    "<S> [ sec : gammaballchiu ] , for completeness , we provide a tensor decomposition of the three gluon vertex . </S>"
  ]
}
